intro: Behenantha, commonly known as Indian buttercup, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ranunculaceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers with five petals and a hairy stem. The plant typically grows in moist, shady areas and is native to regions of Asia, including India and China. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces small, rounded fruits that contain several seeds. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties.
